com.squidtopusstudios.zerobitengine.core

Class ZeroBit

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.squidtopusstudios.zerobitengine.core.ZeroBit

  • public class ZeroBit
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class for managing global resources and settings

      • setLogLevel

        public static void setLogLevel(int logLevel)
        Wrapper for Gdx.app.setLogLevel simply to keep all logging functionality in one place
        Parameters:
        logLevel - Logging level (int) to set: LOG_NONE: mutes all logging. LOG_DEBUG: logs all messages. LOG_ERROR: logs only error messages. LOG_INFO: logs error and normal messages.

      • setBgColour

        public static void setBgColour(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color colour)
        Set the default GL clear colour (background colour). You can use Utils.Colour.fromRGBA() to convert RGBA values into GL float values

      • debugValue

        public static void debugValue(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.Object value)
        Adds an entry to the debug overlay for monitoring custom objects. Unfortunately, due to the way java is purely pass by value, if you want to monitor a changing value you'll need to call this in a method that runs every tick like update() or render() (depending on the class). For example, to monitor the player's x value, I'd call ZeroBit.debugValue("Player X", getX()) in the update() method inside my ZbeEntity class: 'Player'.
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the value, displayed 'name: value'
        value - value to display, displayed 'name: value'

      • setInputMultiplexer

        public static void setInputMultiplexer(com.badlogic.gdx.InputMultiplexer inputMultiplexer)
        Set the InputMultiplexer for the game. Simply add and remove InputProcessor throughout the game accordingly
        Parameters:
        inputMultiplexer - the InputMultiplexer instance to set

      • setGlobalInputProcessor

        public static void setGlobalInputProcessor(ZbeInputProcessor inputProcessor)
        Sets the world ZbeInputProcessor. Access with ZeroBit.input()
        Parameters:
        inputProcessor - ZbeInputProcessor instance to add

      • input

        public static ZbeInputProcessor input()
        Get the global ZbeInputProcessor for the game. Use this to check for key presses on everything but stages
        Returns:
        global registered ZbeInputProcessor for the game
